Description: One end of a cloth of mainly undyed, warp-faced plain weave linen; Decorative band in dark purple wool; Includes extended plain weave, self-bands and knotless warp fringe (c.25cm long); At 9 and 11 cm in from fringe are narrow bands each of four picks of purple wool, warp not grouped; At 21.5 and 34 cm in are two matching and symmetrical bands, in dark purple, each 6.5cm deep, woven on grouped warp threads, and some weft threads grouped; Warp: S spun linen, c.22-30tpc; Weft: S spun linen & wool, c.12 tpc plain weave and c.30tpc in bands; Edges: two plain selvedge at the end of the cloth, only partly preserved, fringe, inner edge cut, other edges torn or ragged
Curator's comments: Includes small bag with three fragments of textile, probably not from the main piece; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (16.8.1994).
Condition: In parts, very good; Faded where once displayed; Some insect damage; No signs of wear
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
